52537.name: {bAdzerak's Laboratory{x
description: {yHere is where the stench of chemicals is the strongest.  It could
possibly be explained by the two large chemical-stained stone tables
filled with alchemical equipment such as braizers, furnaces, beakers,
retorts, distilling coils and the like, plus containers holding
various substances and stacks of books.  By comparison, a small table
in the northeast corner is relatively uncluttered.  A large book lies
open on it, and around the book are a dozen jars of various sizes.  {x

52541.name: {WAdzerak's Library{x
description: {C Huge wooden bookcases stretch from floor to ceiling, and run along
the entire length of each wall, with a square bookcase smack dab in
the middle of the room and each bookcase is completely empty.  There
is no furniture in here, just many shelves devoid of books.  {x

52531.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52520.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52527.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52561.name: {DBlockhouse{x
description: {DThis small room looks to be relatively unimportant.  The wooden
door to the south is hanging open, barely on it's hinges.  The
interior smells of nothing but rotting wood.  There is a set of stairs
that descends into the darkness, though one can only wonder where they
lead to.  {x

52500.name: {yTunnel to Underground{x
description: {DThere is a very rusty ladder leading down into the depths of the
earth, There are only two ways to go and they go further down into the
darkness up back up into the light.  {x

52563.name: {dUnderground Passage{x
description: {DThe stairs that lead down were only half there.  Anyone who was
unlucky enough to walk down them without looking first got a nasty
suprise.  This is an empty corridor that leads into darkness and only
the gods know where else they may lead.  {x

52536.name: {bAdzerak's Laboratory{x
description: {y The stench of still-potent chemicals and the odor of mildew and
rot waft out once the door is opened.  Bright light fills the room,
and the source is apparent; a beautifully carved granite statue of a
ten-foot-tall shapely woman, with an open book in her right hand, and
holding aloft a glowing rod in her left hand.  She is standing in the
southeast corner of the room.  {x

52557.name: {GAdzerak's Stash{x
description: {yHere is where Adzerak seems to have stashed some of his more prized
possessions.  There are some books here that are in very good
condition, as well as a few other trinkets if one were to look around.
{x

52533.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52501.name: {yUnderground Tunnel{x
description: {DThis is a huge tunnel that runs steeply upwards and downwards.
There is room enough in this corridor for five horses to walk abreast.
The corridor seems to descend into darkness or back up into some
lighter darkness.  {x

52502.name: {yUnderground Tunnel{x
description: {DThe ladder disappears now as the tunnel gives way to a corridor.
The walls are dark grey and the floor of the corridor has been worn
down by the feet of many.  Walking along the path that connects the
underworld to the surface world there are several scribbles on the
walls noticeable.  There is a faint {Xlight {Dsomewhere where the sky
should be.  {X

52540.name: {gAdzerak's Bedroom{x
description: {DThere is a pleasant aroma in the air from the wardrobe.  There is a
statue in the southeast corner emitting bright light, making the
entire room visible.  On the floor is a very nice and expensive
looking carpet.  {x

52539.name: {gAdzerak's Bedroom{x
description: {DHere is a very lavish bed.  It has an intricately detailed "A"
carved into the headboard, and it looks to be very comfortable.  There
are a few books on the nightstand next to the bed.  The rot and decay
that has seemingly taken over the rest of the mansion has not spread
to this room.  There is a crack in the northern wall.  {x

52534.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52558.name: {MShrine{x
description: {D The door to this room comes open easily.  Inside is a sparse room
with a stone block two feet on a side, and a statue looming behind it.
The statue is a representation of a winged, robed man clutching an
hour glass in one arm, and a scythe in the other.  The hourglass is on
a chain, and the chain's other end is attached to a neck collar,
forever linking the figure and the hourglass.  Although a certain
sense of sanctity is within the room, there neither a sinister
atmosphere, nor a compassionate one.  The room feels like a haven of
propriety and order, but of such a nature that it favors neither the
just nor unjust.  {x

52507.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {rThe air is very foul and stifling.  There are some markings on the
wall and a very thick layer of dust is on the floor.  There is a small
metal disc hanging by the door that is blocking the way south.  {x
{yNo entry without an Appointment{x
{yNo entry without an Appointment{x

52526.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52544.name: {WSouthern Dormitory{x
description: {D The door to this room hangs loosely on its hinges.  Looking
inside, one would be hardpressed to identify even one piece of
furniture.  It looks as if an extremely efficient vandal took special
care to reduce everything in this room to kindling.  Splintered wood,
shattered glass, torn cloth and a layer of goosedown feathers cover
the floor.  {x

52555.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThe corridor leads off into the east and north.  On the walls there
are some more paintings that are so intricately detailed, one has to
wonder who the artist is.  There are no two paintings that are the
same.  If they were not set into the walls, they would probably fetch
a high price at the market.  {x

52519.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52543.name: {WNorthern Dormitory{x
description: {D Although the door to this room is in better shape than the one to
the south, the interior of the chamber is much the same; devastated
beyond recognition, as if someone tore everything apart with their
bare hands.  {x

52512.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {rThe air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  A chandelier still hangs from the ceiling in the center of
this antechamber.  {x

52547.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThe narrow hallway turns to the south and widens considerably, but
passage through the area still takes time because of extensive heaps
of rubble scattered here and there.  Obviously, not every part of this
structure held up to centuries of neglect.  {x

52532.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52542.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {D The corridor leading north and south expands to a twenty foot
width.  A sloping wall of rubble is all that is to the east, and on
the west wall there are paintings of different battle scenes.  Each
scene is highly detailed and very well put together.  {x

52506.name: {yThe entry to {cAdzerak's Mansion{x
description: {rThe trapdoor opens grudgingly, with a loud shriek of rusted hinges.
The odor of mold and decay coming from the mansion is an indication
that there hasn't been anyone here in centuries.  A corridor leads to
the south.  {x

52551.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThe corridor leading north expands to a twenty foot width.  The
corridor leads off into the east and on the west wall there are more
intricate paintings of different battle scenes.  Each scene is highly
detailed and very well put together.  {x

52504.name: {yUnderground Tunnel{x
description: {D The air smells of thousands living in a confined space with little
fresh air.  The shadows seems to speak of death.  There is a door to
the north and the tunnel leads up as well.  {x

52550.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThe corridor leading north and south expands to a twenty foot
width.  A sloping wall of rubble is all that is to the east, and on
the west wall there are paintings of different battle scenes.  Each
scene is highly detailed and very well put together.  {x

52562.name: {dUnderground Passage{x
description: {DThis is an empty corridor that leads into darkness to the north and
the south.  Only the gods know where else they may lead.  Perhaps
there might be some light at the end of this wretched tunnel of
despair.  {x

52565.name: {DAdzerak's Private Garden{x
description: {DThis small stone room beneath the garden seems to serve many
purposes.  There are mirrors lined along the walls and the floor is
covered with a mosaic of an eye surmounted by a candle.  To the east
there is a door inset into the wall with the same symbol above it.  On
the west wall is another large door, this one displaying the
mesmerizing face of a god.  To the north a small, indescript door is
in the wall, with no marks to identify it.  The door to the south
glows with a soft light and it is humming.  {x

52524.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52514.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {rThe air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  A few moldering chairs and couches, which look like they
were pretty comfortable a few centuries ago, are scattered about the
room.  {x

52513.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {rThe air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  A few moldering chairs and couches, which look like they
were pretty comfortable a few centuries ago, are scattered about the
room.  There is a door set in the wall here leading to places unknown.
{x

52549.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThe corridor leading north and south expands to a twenty foot
width.  A sloping wall of rubble is all that is to the east, and on
the west wall there are paintings of different battle scenes.  Each
scene is highly detailed and very well put together.  {x

52511.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {rThe air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  There is a very impressive set of double doors here set
into the wall.  These doors are set with stained glass that still
looks beautiful, and on each one is a carving of an eye surmounted by
a candle.  {x

52538.name: {gAdzerak's Bedroom
description: {DT{rh{Di{rs {Dr{ro{Do{rm {Dc{ro{Dn{rt{Da{ri{Dn{rs {Da{rn {Do{rp{Du{rl{De{rn{Dt {rb{De{rd {Dw{ri{Dt{rh {Da{rn {De{rl{Da{rb{Do{rr{Da{rt{De {r"{DA{r" {Dc{ra{Dr{rv{De{rd {Di{rn {Dt{rh{De

52521.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52567.name: {DAdzerak's Private Sanctum{x
description: {DThis long room is brightly lit with many magical lanterns.  The air
smells of ancient leather, old paper, and bodily decay.  There is a
simple wooden table standing in the center of the room, and an ornate,
cushioned chair is next to it on the side of the table opposite the
door.  Books are everywhere throughout the room, placed in numerous
disarrayed stacks that tower to the ceiling.  {x

52503.name: {yUnderground Tunnel{x
description: {D There is a huge door blocking the way southwards.  On the wall to
the north are a series of unremarkable scribbles.  The floor is
slanted slightly leading further down into the earth.  {x

52525.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52515.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {rThe air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  A few moldering chairs and couches, which look like they
were pretty comfortable a few centuries ago, are scattered about the
room.  There is a door on the wall to the south that looks to be made
of very expensive wood.  {x

52529.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52568.name: {DChamber of the Dead{x
description: {DThe door leading into this room sticks, as it is protesting being
opened after so many centuries.  After much pushing and pulling and
grunting, it opens up and a horde of skeletal bodies spills out,
flailing at everyone.  {x

52517.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52546.name: {-T{-r{-e{-a{-s{-u{-r{-e {WRoom{x
description: {BThis is the room where Adzerak kept his most prized possessions.
He always told his understudies it was a room full of the most
valuable of all things in the realms.  This room seems to have been
able to avoid the destruction of the rest of the house.  {x

52553.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThe corridor leads off into the east and west.  On the walls there
are some more paintings that are so intricately detailed, one has to
wonder who the artist is.  There are no two paintings that are the
same.  If they were not set into the walls, they would probably fetch
a high price at the market.  {x

52535.name: {bAdzerak's Laboratory{x
description: {yThe stench of still-potent chemicals and the odor of mildew and rot
waft out once the door is opened.  Bright light fills the room, and
the source is to the south.  To the north there are some tables, and
there is a door on the east wall.  {x

52516.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {rThe air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  A few moldering chairs and couches, which look like they
were pretty comfortable a few centuries ago, are scattered about the
room.  The chair here looks to be in the best shape out of all of the
furniture in this room.  {x

52518.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52505.name: {yUnderground Tunnel{x
description: {DThis is a huge tunnel that runs steeply upwards and downwards.
There is room enough in this corridor for five horses to walk abreast.
There is a trapdoor directly up, and upon closer inspection it feels
to be heavy.  The corridor seems to descend into darkness or up into
the unknown.  {x

52508.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {r The air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  There are doors on the other walls leading out into other
places.  {x

52554.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThe corridor leads off into the east and west.  On the walls there
are some more paintings that are so intricately detailed, one has to
wonder who the artist is.  There are no two paintings that are the
same.  If they were not set into the walls, they would probably fetch
a high price at the market.  {x

52528.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52530.name: {rAdzerak's Den{x
description: {gThe reward for getting past the locked door is what looks to be a
far more comfortable room than the antechamber.  One immediately
noticeable improvement is the air quality.  A thick layer of dust
covers the furniture, carpet, and bookcases.  The furniture in here
looks to have withstood a few centuries worth of decay, as they are
not as bad as what was in the antechamber.  {x

52559.name: {DPartially Sunken Room{x
description: {DA blast of humid, rancid air welcomes all who enter this room as
the door is opened.  Half of this room has collapsed into a swampy
mire, perhaps due to a spell gone awry.  A couple of small,
slime-covered boulders are poking out of the ooze.  The dry portion of
this room has piles of old, warped wooden bowls, a fire pit with
ancient ashes, and some extremely rusted tools that appear to be
cooking utensils.  {x

52548.name: {yA corridor{x
description: {cThe air in this corridor is musty and thick with the dust of ages.
The walls are painted with fading frescoes depicting robed men and
women battling {Dundead, {Bdragons, {Relementals, {cand the like.  Not a
single warrior type is to be seen in any of the illustrations.  Each
piece of art has a title engraved in a small metal plaque set into the
wall below the illustration.  There is a door to the north and the
south.  {x

52522.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52556.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {D There is a door to the east, and looks to be made of some type of
metal that is new to the senses.  All over the walls, ceiling and
floor are carvings of symbols.  The corridor goes to the south.  {x

52569.name: {WAdzerak's Garden{x
description: {D When one steps into the Sacred Garden they see before them a ring
of the most beautiful flowers in existance, surrounding an enormous
pool where several nymphs are playing and laughing.  By day, the sun
sparkles on the water, by night, the stars smile fondly upon the still
gardens.  {x

52510.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {rThe air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  A few moldering couches and chairs, which look like they
were pretty comfortable a few centuries ago, are scattered about the
room.  There is a set of double ago, are scattered about the room.
There is a set of double doors to the south.  {x

52509.name: {yThe {cAntechamber{x
description: {rThe air in here is foul and stifling, probably because any
ventilation shafts have been long since blocked up by the debris of
centuries.  A chandelier still hangs on the ceiling of this large
antechamber.  A few moldering chairs and couches, which look like they
were pretty comfortable a few centuries ago, are scattered about the
room.  {x

52545.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThere is a door to the north here.  It is made of very heavy iron,
heavily engraved with various decorations and arcane symbols.  A stout
steel lock is set into the door.  The corridor continues to the east
and west.  {x

52552.name: {yA Corridor{x
description: {DThe corridor leads off into the east and west.  On the walls there
are some more paintings that are so intricately detailed, one has to
wonder who the artist is.  There are no two paintings that are the
same.  If they were not set into the walls, they would probably fetch
a high price at the market.  {x

52564.name: {cInner Sanctum{x
description: {rThis large stone room is the inner sanctum of the priesthood of
some god of knowledge, as their are books strewn all about.  Here the
holy priests would come to meditate and to live.  Tapestries line the
walls depicting memorable events in the history of the priesthood, and
small cots are lined up in one corner of the room.  {x

52566.name: {DArmoury{x
description: {DThe room is filled with debris that has sealed the door shut.  The
stack of rubbish includes dozens of rotted and dented shields, rusted
swords, and suits of armour of an archaic design, a type not seen for
more than a thousand years.  {x

52523.name: {mShrine to {MDeneir{x
description: {MA feeling of security and enlightenment covers all who enter this
room.  Despite the lack of functioning ventilation, the air still
seems healthy and comfortable.  A simple stone altar with a small
flame flickering in the air above it stands against the west wall.
The walls are decorated with carvings of every glyph, symbol and
letter of all written languages known throughout Faerun.  {x

52560.name: {CHealing Pool{x
description: {BWithin this room there is a tree that somehow has retained its
youthful characteristics.  At the base of the tree, there is a
beautiful and stunning spring, with water flowing over the edges
towards the ground only to evaporate a few feet down.  Steam can be
seen rising from the water, giving off a warm and comfortable feeling.
The tree trunk grows through the center of the spring reaching up
higher and higher still.  Warm crystal clear water seems to glow from
everywhere as it surrounds the whole level of the tree help in place
by powerful magic.  {x

52546.name: {RAn efreeti{x~
description:
{RThe efreet are genies from the elemental plane of Fire.  They are
said to be made of basalt, bronze and solid flames, but whatever their
makeup, they are massive, solid creatures.  {x
52546.d_flags: D {RThe efreeti glares at it's killer with a look of revenge in its eyes.{x~

F imm L
F vul S

{DThis crawler looks like a cross between a giant green cutworm and a
cephalopod.  Like so many other hybrid monsters, the carrion crawler
may well be the result of genetic experiementation by a mad, evil
wizard.  {x

52569.name: A Nymph~

So beautiful that a glimpse can blind or even kill a man, the
nymphs are the embodiement of loveliness, a triumph of nature.
52569.room_name: A lovely woman playing in the water is here.
